title: Chart Generation
descriptions:
Here is an abstract of the academic paper:

This paper explores the application of chart parsing, a technique traditionally used in parsing natural language, to the task of generation. The authors investigate whether chart parsing can serve as a natural uniform architecture for both parsing and generation, and whether it offers advantages comparable to those that make it attractive in parsing. They discuss the algorithm schema for chart parsing and its extension to generation, and highlight the importance of indexing in reducing the computational complexity of the generation process. The authors propose a modified version of the chart parsing algorithm for generation, which uses active and inactive edges to interact through shared indices. They demonstrate the effectiveness of this approach using the sentence "The procedure will be reminiscent of left-corner parsing." The paper contributes to the development of more efficient and effective generation algorithms, and sheds light on the potential of chart parsing in the context of natural language generation.
